item.title: Daily Update
item.description:

item.title: Daily Update
item.description:
How about your state of health?

  • Body: Not bad. Have a bit headache.
  • Mind: Good.

How was your day today?

What I did

  • Took an English lesson in the morning.
    • Understood the difference between “I feel ~” and “I feel like ~”
    • We should use “I feel like ~” literally when I feel “like” (not directly but feel we feel next to some emotions)
    • So, when we’d like to express some virtual situations, we should use “I feel like ~”
      • For instance, “I felt like I was on cloud 9”.
    • When we’d like to express some direct emotions, we should use “I feel ~”
      • For example, “I felt so happy”.
  • Made progress in my side business.
  • Read MINDSET till p.189/350.

Feelings

It was a kind of productive day today nevertheless I had no plan. It’s been confortable temperture in Tokyo because of recent rains. It’s about 23 degrees Celsius.

item.title: Time complexity of serveral operations for list in Python
item.description:
Summary

  • All of the Objects used in Python are defined as PyObject extension.
  • We can treat List in Python basically the same as C lang’s.
    • Access to an element in a List in Python takes O(1) time complexity, which is the same as C lang’s random access to an array.
    • Access to elements in a List using slice in Python takes O(k) time complexity (k means the slice’s length) because it is implemented as new memory allocation and copy elements using for loop.
    • list.pop(x) takes O(n) time complexity (len(list) is n) because the elements that have bigger indices than x have to be moved to the previous array.

References

  • Pythonのlist型の実装を読んでみる - 今日も窓辺でプログラム

item.title: Daily Update
